definition: to pay no heed to (idiom)/to ignore/to brush aside
to install/to place/to put/to buy
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
(negative prefix)/not/no
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.chinese: 他對我的反對置之不理。

sentences.english: Only in a sparsely -populated rural community is it possible to disregard it.
sentences.chinese: 只有在人口稀少的農業社會，纔可以對此置之不理。

sentences.english: Saying that many of recommendations from himself and the group were ignored by Mr.
sentences.chinese: 小浴說首相菅對他和專家組的許多建議置之不理。

sentences.english: But to those remonstrances Mr. Qulip turned a deaf ear.
sentences.chinese: 但是對於這些忠告，奎爾普先生置之不理。

sentences.english: He refused to listen to her tearful pleas.
sentences.chinese: 他對她聲淚俱下的懇求置之不理。

sentences.english: An appeal so worded could not be set aside without a grave responsibility .
sentences.chinese: 這呼籲如此措詞，使我感到責任重大，不易置之不理。

sentences.english: He ignored other people's advice that he give up gambling.
sentences.chinese: 他對人們勸他戒賭的建議置之不理。

sentences.english: Nixon was less likely to brush off the bearer of unwelcome intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松不大可能對他的逆耳之言置之不理。
他們對我們的建議置之不理。

sentences.english: You become overloaded with warnings and eventually just tune them out.
sentences.chinese: 不絕於耳的警告最終使你對它們置之不理。
她對他的苦惱置之不理。

sentences.english: Can we afford to ignore these issues?
sentences.chinese: 對於這些問題，我們能置之不理嗎？

sentences.english: All the pleadings were brushed aside.
sentences.chinese: 所有的懇求都被置之不理。

sentences.english: Wubu officials did not respond to repeated inquiries.
sentences.chinese: 吳堡的官員對於頻繁的詢問始終置之不理。

sentences.english: Such docility is unusual given the level of provocation.
sentences.chinese: 對於這種水平的挑釁行爲置之不理顯然是很不正常的。

sentences.english: My loving-kindness will not let me ignore him.
sentences.chinese: 慈愛之心不能讓我置之不理，我必須救他。

definition: to turn a deaf ear to (idiom); to pretend not to hear
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to completely ignore (idiom)/to pay no attention to/not to be in the least concerned about
to take a laissez-faire attitude
to turn a blind eye to
to block one's ears and not listen (idiom); to turn a deaf ear
to play deaf-mute
to refuse to acknowledge/to pay no attention to/to take no notice of/to ignore
to sit and watch, but remain indifferent (idiom)
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to ignore/to let alone/to indulge
to pay no attention to a familiar sight/to ignore
to set to one side and ignore (idiom); quite indifferent/cold and uncaring
